_header: Summer is comen with love to toun
Subjects: birds, as narrators; dialogues, bird; women, debates concerning
_description: The Thrush and the Nightingale — in 12-line stanzas

BodDig86.First Lines:
Somer is comen wiþ loue to touneWiþ blostme
                    and wiþ brides roune…
BodDig86.Last Lines: …Ne rechi neuere weder I fleA wai ich wille driue
BodDig86.Attributed Title:
Ci comence le cuntent par entre le Mauuis et la russinole (f.
                        136v)

NLS1921.First Lines:
L[enten is comen] wiþ loue [to toun]Wiþ blosme &
                    wiþ briddes roun…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…Thane leue to aliȝt hereIn orchard & in
                    erbere…
NLS1921.Note: 74 lines; begins and ends imperfectly. Cf. 3050.
